tit.e: Kanjo bugyo (a governmental post in the Edo period)

sen.j: 勘定奉行（かんじょうぶぎょう）は江戸幕府の職名の一つで、勘定方の最高責任者で財政や天領支配などを司る。
sen.e: Kanjo bugyo was a governmental post in the Edo period, and being the post for the highest one of the accounting officers, was in charge of finance and control of the tenryo (the areas controlled directly by the bakufu).
Kanjo bugyo was a governmental post in the Edo period and the highest accounting officer, who was in charge of finance and control of the tenryo (the areas controlled directly by the bakufu).

sen.j: 寺社奉行・町奉行とともに三奉行の一つで、共に評定所を構成した。
sen.e: This bugyo post constituted the three bugyo posts together with the jisha-bugyo post (in charge of affairs of shrines and temples) and the machi-bugyo post (in charge of affairs of town people), and the officers in these posts became the members of hyojosho (a conference chamber).

This bugyo constituted the three bugyo together with jisha-bugyo (in charge of affairs of shrines and temples) and machi-bugyo (in charge of affairs of town people), and these theree bugyo were the members of hyojosho (a conference chamber).

sen.j: 元禄年間までは勘定頭（かんじょうがしら）とも称した。
sen.e: By the Genroku era (1688 - 1703), this post was also called kanjo-gashira (the head of accounting officers).

sen.j: 評定所においては、関八州内江戸府外の訴訟について担当した。
sen.e: In the hyojosho, law suits in Kanhasshu (the eight provinces of Kanto region), except Edo-fu, were handled.
sen.cmt: 江戸府： ”江戸”とどこが違うのか、調べきれませんでしたので、音読みで"Edo-fu”としてあります。
sen.e: In the hyojosho, law suits in Kanhasshu (the eight provinces of Kanto region) except Edo-fu were handled by the kanji bugyo.
sen.cmt: 担当したのが勘定奉行であるということを明確にしました。
sen.e: In the hyojosho, law suits in Kanhasshu (the eight provinces of Kanto region) except Edo-fu were handled by the kanji bugyo.

sen.j: 定員は約4人で役高は3000石。
sen.e: The number of the officers in the post was four, and the amount of rice crop allocated to the officer was 3000 koku (approx. 180 liters/koku).
The number of kanjo bugyo was four, and the amount of rice yields allocated to the officer was 3000 koku (approx. 180 liters/koku).

sen.j: 老中の下にあり、郡代・代官・蔵奉行などを支配した。
sen.e: Placed directly under Roju (the second-highest post in the bakufu government), the officers controlled Gundai (a post of controlling territories of the bakufu), Daikan (also a post of controlling territories of the bakufu, but the controlling area is smaller than that of Gundai), and Kurabugyo (the officer in charge of the rice crop stock of the bakufu).

sen.j: 1698年以降は、うち1人が大目付とともに道中奉行を兼務した。
sen.e: In 1698 and later, one of the officers in this post was also in charge of Dochu-bugyo (the post in charge of road-related affairs) together with Ometsuke (the post of watching daimyo and the Imperial court).

sen.j: 1721年には財政・民政を主に扱う勝手方勘定奉行と訴訟関連を扱う公事方勘定奉行とにわかれた。
sen.e: In 1721, the post was separated into the Kattekata-kanjo-bugyo post dealing mainly with finance and civil administration and the Kujikata-kanjo-bugyo post dealing mainly with law suit-related matters.

sen.j: 勝手方と公事方の職務は全く別のものであり、事実上名称のみが共通している状態であった。
sen.e: The job of the Kattekata post and that of the Kujikata post were totally different, though the same title name was used.
